page.title: 09Dunnington, Changing Life
page.content: Mrs.Stevenson has lived in Dunnington for forty four years since 1941.She left school at fourteen and went to work.During this time she went to feasts at Barmby Moor and shows at Bishop Wilton. She had no holidays until she was married but they celebrated Empire Day on the 24 and Royal Oak Day on the 29 of May. On Empire Day they walked around the playground and saluted the Union Jack. On Royal Oak Day everyone had to wear a piece of oak because of the king who hid in an oak tree. During the war she had evacuees from Hull and soldiers lived in the village. She had to do war work and spent some time with the railways. She helped after York Station was bombed. She vividly remembers the Queen's coronation year, 1953, when something different happened every day.
